item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, October 30, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Australia/Lord_Howe is the weirdest timezone (45 points | 10 comments)
2. Matrix 2.0 is here (57 points | 62 comments)
3. Async Rust is not safe with io_uring (13 points | 12 comments)
4. Syncthing Android app discontinued (28 points | 19 comments)
5. Eighteen years of ABI stability (curl) (11 points | 2 comments)
6. Port forwarding between your local machine and Kubernetes (6 points | 1 comment)
7. One weird trick to get the whole planet to send abuse complaints to your best friend(s) (121 points | 16 comments)
8. Using an 8K TV as a monitor (6 points | 9 comments)
9. Looking into the Nintendo Alarmo (5 points | no comments)
10. Observability in distributed systems (3 points | no comments)
11. Saltproject.io moving all public repos to broadcom.com by end of month (18 points | 14 comments)
12. RIP botsin.space (37 points | 6 comments)
13. How we shrunk our Javascript monorepo git size by 94% (37 points | 14 comments)
14. The question of whether to still allow HTTP/1.0 requests or block them (15 points | 8 comments)
15. You can now run prompts against images, audio and video in your terminal using LLM (20 points | no comments)
16. AI Flame Graphs (6 points | no comments)
17. malloc(0) & realloc(…，0) != 0 (2 points | 1 comment)
18. Make It Ephemeral: Software Should Decay and Lose Data (7 points | 3 comments)
19. Object to Your Information Being Used for AI at Meta (WhatsApp) (10 points | 12 comments)
20. 1BRC: Nerd Sniping the Java Community (3 points | no comments)
21. Un-Deprecate : my plea to the w3c (5 points | 30 comments)
22. CVE-2024-9632 xorg-x11-server: heap-based buffer overflow privilege escalation vulnerability (8 points | 12 comments)
23. Wimsey: fast, lightweight and easy data contract library (supporting Pandas, Polars, Arrow + more, via narwhals) (1 points | no comments)
24. A free and open source map of the world, deployable as a single static file (82 points | 10 comments)
25. Set me right on whether caring is even possible (6 points | 1 comment)
